lines.content: ### helix.Helix Chatbot: Your Personal Task Manager

helix.Helix is a simple, intuitive, and interactive chatbot designed to help you manage your tasks efficiently. Whether you're adding to-dos, setting deadlines, or planning events, helix.Helix is here to assist you every step of the way.
- Add tasks to your helix.task list (To-Dos, Deadlines, Events).
- Mark tasks as completed or unmark them.
- Delete tasks when no longer needed.
- View a list of all your tasks.
- Exit the chatbot with a friendly farewell message.
- A terminal or an IDE like IntelliJ IDEA, Eclipse, or VS Code.
Here are the commands you can use with helix.Helix:
| `todo <description>` | Adds a simple to-do helix.task. Example: `todo Read a book`                   |
| `deadline <description> /by <due date>` | Adds a helix.task with a deadline. Example: `deadline Submit report /by 2025-01-30` |
| `event <description> /from <start time> /to <end time>` | Adds an event helix.task. Example: `event Team meeting /from 10am /to 12pm` |
| `list`        | Displays all the tasks in your list.                                        |
| `mark <helix.task number>` | Marks the specified helix.task as done. Example: `mark 1`                      |
| `unmark <helix.task number>` | Marks the specified helix.task as not done. Example: `unmark 1`              |
| `delete <helix.task number>` | Deletes the specified helix.task. Example: `delete 1`                       |
ğŸ¤– [helix.Helix] : Hello! I'm your personal assistant, helix.Helix.
ğŸ¤– [helix.Helix] : What can I do for you today?
You now have 1 helix.task(s) in your list.
You now have 2 helix.task(s) in your list.
You now have 3 helix.task(s) in your list.
You now have 2 helix.task(s) in your list.
ğŸ¤– [helix.Helix] : Bye! Hope to see you soon! ğŸ‘‹
âœ¨ Thank you for using helix.Helix. Have a great day! âœ¨

* The main class for the Helix personal assistant application.
* This class serves as the entry point for the Helix application, managing the initialization
* of components such as storage, the task list, and the user interface. It also handles the
* main program loop, which processes user commands and executes them using polymorphism.
* Constructs a new instance of the Helix application with the specified storage file path.
* @param filePath the file path to the storage file where tasks are saved and loaded

* Runs the main program loop for the Helix application.
* This method initializes the user interface, handles user input, and delegates command
* execution to the appropriate components. It continues to run until the exit command

* Abstract base class representing a generic helix.command.

* Exception thrown when a date format is invalid.

* @param exampleFormat an example format showing the correct syntax for the helix.command
super("The helix.command '" + command + "' requires additional arguments. " +
* Exception thrown when a helix.task index is out of bounds.
* Constructs a TaskIndexOutOfBoundsException with a detailed error message.
* @param index the index that was invalid
* @param size  the size of the helix.task list
super("Task number " + index + " does not exist. You only have " + size + " helix.task(s) in your list.");
* Exception thrown when a helix.command has more arguments than expected.
* Constructs a {@code TooManyArgumentsException} with a default error message.
super("Too many arguments provided. Please check the helix.command format.");
* Constructs a {@code TooManyArgumentsException} with a custom error message.
* @param exampleFormat an example of the correct helix.command format
super("The helix.command '" + command + "' received too many arguments. " +
* Handles the saving and loading of tasks from a file.
* The tasks are stored in a plain text file and are serialised / de-serialised using a specific format.

* If the file or its parent directory does not exist, they are created, and an empty list is returned.
* @return a {@link List} of {@link Task} objects loaded from the helix.storage file
* @throws IOException if there is an error reading the file
// check if helix.storage folder and file exists
Files.createDirectories(filePath.getParent());  // create directory if it does not exist
Files.createFile(filePath);                     // create file if it does not exist
return new ArrayList<>();                       // return an empty list for first-time use
// helix.storage file exists, read and populate taskList

* Displays the welcome message when the application starts.
